messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] it won't be pretty but Pris is doing RAIN DANCES!!!
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 9/7/2000 11:52:22 PM Central Daylight Time, ... Bizarre that we should be grateful for a 96!  Today, I was SO thankful for the cool
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 9/7/2000 11:52:22 PM Central Daylight Time,
x_t_sipr@... writes:

> HOLD ON CARRON!!! @ 10 pm the weatherman said WE *SHOULD* HAVE RAIN
> TOMORROW??? OR SATURDAY???!!! so just keep your eye on the GULF!!! YAH!!!
> it only reached 96* today and felt GREAT, 15* LOWER than Tuesday's 111*!!!
> AARRGGHH!!!
>

Bizarre that we should be grateful for a 96! Today, I was SO thankful for
the "cool" weather 'cause I was in a wedding this afternoon that took place
outside! The heat broke just in time, and despite the cloudy skies, it was a
gorgeous ceremony. Only, I don't think we'll get that rain today.

And my dh is going into the woods with some guys down in the Hill Country
this weekend. Heat broke JUST in time!

> the San Marcos, Guadulupe and Frio Rivers are still running, which I'm SO
> surprised they haven't dried up ... I saw a report that the Blanco River
was
> BONE DRY (I think it wsa the BR)??? AND SO MANY GRASS FIRES!!! the
> countryside is just PARCHED!!! dh said he's really nervous b/c sparks from
> the wheels of the train start fires all the time and MANY of the tankcars
> are FLAMABLE materials; wellllllll great, that's just one more thing to
> worry about while he's on the road :(
>
Hopefully, something will happen soon. I'm so darn tired of the sun! I
don't think we'll be making that tubing trip down the Guadulupe this year.
Now, we may walk down it!

> btw ... since you are a Dallasonian do you know the name of the park/area
> that has the dinosaur tracks located near Dallas??? we wanted to see this
> next week but for the LIFE OF ME, I don't recall the name??? tia :)

Sure, you're talking about Dinosaur Valley State Park -- it's near Glen Rose,
south of Cleburne. You can get some information on the park and directions
to it from the Texas Parks and Rec website: www.tpwd.state.tx.us. It is
pretty awesome to go down in the river bed and actually walk in the footsteps
of dinosaurs. Also in that area is the Rossil Rim Wildlife Center, a drive
through wild animal park where you get to feed the animals from your car. We
really like it there. Try www.fossilrim.com. But, that's all about 1 to 1
1/2 hours south of here.

> *YES*, we almost had to pull air out our sweaters from mothballs today b/c
> it *only* reached 96*!!! ohhhhh, it felt GREAT ... it's funny how just 15*
> LOWER helps you keep your SANITY!!! :}
>
Yea, I thought the same thing! It was actually a pleasure taking the dog for
his walk this morning.

Good luck Grandma!!

Carron
